did.unittitle: Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force records

bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force was a human rights advocacy organization focused on law, public policy, and the development of public education and mass media. Founded in 1978, the Task Force supported the rights of all oppressed minorities, with a particular focus on the civil and human rights of gay men and lesbian women and transgendered and/or bisexual people.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Philadelphia Lesbian and Gay Task Force. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence; minutes, agendas, and planning documents of the board; financial records; policy and program recommendations; surveys, studies, and reports; speeches; various publications by the PLGTF, including the Bulletin (1980-1985); videos and audio cassettes of meetings and radio and television productions; legal briefings and court transcripts; and ephemera. The collection also documents PLGTFâ€™s participation in the petition to deny license renewal applications of Philadelphia commercial and non-commercial radio and television stations (1989-1994).
